paragraph.heading:
Curculio cristinae Pelsue and Zhang
,
new species

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype . China . Xishuangbanna : female[ China / Yunnan /Xishuangbanna/2200 M/
21 September 1957
/ L. Zang ] ( IZAS )

subSubSection.paragraph: Recognition Characters. Broadly oval; hind femur exceeding apex of abdomen; abdominal sternites one and two densely clothed with clavate decumbent cretaceous scales; pronotum broadly convex in lateral view; disk with a centrobasal defuse macula of narrow elongate aeneous and a few clavate decumbent cretaceous scales mixed in a whorl; elytra with a centrolateral fascia of clavate decumbent cretaceous scales on intervals six through eight.

Description. Female. Length: 5.1 mm . Width: 3.1 mm . Head. Small, slightly convex; derm fuscorufous; punctures small; macula of small, decumbent, white scales under rostrum between eyes; vestiture of narrow, elongate, decumbent, aeneous scales; eyes large, round, finely faceted; frons 0.21 as broad as head across eyes; clothed with narrow, elongate, decumbent, aeneous scales; small median slit like interocular fovea. Rostrum. Length: 4.5 mm , 0.89 as long as body; dorsal surface fuscous from frons to apex, lateral surface testaceous; cylindrical; sides subparallel gradually tapering to apex; gradually emerging or continuous with head; three dorsal carinae from frons to antennal insertion; oval punctures between carinae; emerging rather straight for the first two thirds of its length then broadly curving to apex; scrobe lateral; scape inserted past one third of its length. Antennae. Length of scape 1.4 mm , funicular segment one 0.4 mm , two 0.5 mm , three 0.3 mm , four 0.2 mm , five 0.2 mm , six 0.2 mm , seven 0.2 mm , club 0.55 mm ; funicle 2.0 mm; scape 0.70 as long as funicle; derm fuscous; moderately clothed with elongate, decumbent, white scales with longer semierect setae towards the apex of segments three through seven; club elongate, acuminate, clothed with fine setae, few erect setae, not as long as funicular segments four through seven. Thorax. Length: 1.5 mm . Width: 2.3 mm , 0.66 as long as body; derm fuscous; disc sides parallel to past midpoint then broadly rounded to constriction; laterally subimpressed; in lateral view dorsal surface somewhat convex; broader than long; base sinuate; punctures small, oval to round, close together; clothed with narrow, elongate, decumbent, aeneous scales mixed with clavate decumbent cretaceous scales; there is a dorsal basocentral diffuse macula in a whorl shaped of golden and a few cretaceous decumbent scales. Anteroventral below head pronotum clothed with short, broad, clavate, decumbent, cretaceous scales; mesosternal intercoxal process very prominent one half anvil shaped, clothed with clavate, decumbent, cretaceous scales; scutellum large with bright cretaceous scales; mesepimeron with dorsal fringe of clavate, decumbent, cretaceous scales and aeneous scales mixed with cretaceous scales ventrally; mesepisternum sparsely clothed with clavate, decumbent, aeneous and a few cretaceous scales; metepisternum narrowing toward distal end clothed with few cretaceous scales anteriorly and aeneous scales posteriorly; procoxae clothed with narrow, elongate, some broad clavate decumbent cretaceous scales. Elytra. Length: 3.5 mm . Derm fuscous; striae deep, broad with scattered clavate cretaceous scales emerging from deep punctures; basal declivity around scutellum; humeri rounded; intervals broad, flat, clothed with elongate, aeneous, decumbent scales with cretaceous scales intermixed; centrolaterally with a cretaceous fascia on intervals six through eight; disc flat in lateral view; crosshatch setae long, erect starting out aeneous then becoming piceous toward apex. Legs. Length of hind femur 2.8 mm , exceeds apex of abdomen, tooth large, thorn shaped, with proximolateral sulcus; pro­ and mesofemoral tooth medium, not as long as hind femoral tooth; derm fuscous; all femora clothed with narrow, elongate, decumbent aeneous and cretaceous scales; hind tibia sinuate with dense apical comb extending up tibia one quarter of its length; pro­ and mesouncus large longer than tarsal claw; metauncus small. Abdomen. Derm fuscous; first sternite longer than two behind coxal cavity; second sternite ascending to three; sternites three and four combined longer than five; apex of sternite five acute; sternites one and two with lateral macula of clavate, decumbent, cretaceous scales, remaining sternites with narrow elongate, decumbent, fuscous scales.
Pygidium .
covered. Genitalia. Spermatheca: Ramus tilted, rounded; collum rounded defined from ramus; cornu thickened basely tapering to narrowed slightly turned up apex ( Fig. 36 ).

caption.paragraph:
Figs. 22–23.
Curculio fausti
male, habitus, dorsal and lateral views, holotype. Various scales.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. China . Yunnan Province , Xishuangbanna, 2200 M., 21 September 1957 , L. Zang Collector. Unique.
